item.title: 特朗普将对从委内瑞拉购买石油和天然气的国家征收 25% 的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一表示，任何从委内瑞拉购买石油或天然气的国家都将在与美国的贸易中支付 25% 的关税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that any country that buys oil or gas from Venezuela will pay a 25 percent tariff on trades made with the United States.】

item.title: 海运业高管在听证会上表示，特朗普对中国船只征收的费用将损害美国公司的利益
item.description: 行业高管将在本周举行的听证会上告诉美国贸易代表，唐纳德-特朗普总统振兴美国造船业的计划很可能会适得其反，因为该计划依赖于对与中国有联系的船只征收费用的提议，这将损害国内船舶运营商和港口。【原文：President Donald Trump's plan to revitalize the U.S. shipbuilding industry is likely to backfire because it relies on proposed fees on China-linked vessels that will hurt domestic ship operators and ports, industry executives will tell the U.S. Trade Representative at hearings this week.】

item.title: Firefly Aerospace 公司选择蓝色起源公司的设备探索月球上的火山构造
item.description: 总部位于得克萨斯州的火箭制造商萤火虫宇航公司（Firefly Aerospace）周一表示，该公司已与蓝色起源公司（Blue Origin）旗下的蜜蜂机器人公司（Honeybee Robotics）合作，为其2028年的第三次月球任务提供一辆漫游车，以研究格鲁伊图森圆顶（Gruithuisen Domes）。【原文：Firefly Aerospace has partnered with Blue Origin's Honeybee Robotics to supply a rover for its third lunar mission in 2028 to study the Gruithuisen Domes, the Texas-based rocket maker said on Monday.】

item.title: 据 CoinDesk 报道，Sam Altman 的 World Network 正在与 Visa 商谈稳定币钱包事宜
item.description: 据 CoinDesk 周一援引一位熟悉该项计划的人士的话报道，山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）的加密货币项目 World Network 正在与支付巨头 Visa 就稳定币支付钱包进行谈判。【原文：Sam Altman's cryptocurrency project World Network is in talks with payments giant Visa for a stablecoin payments wallet, CoinDesk reported on Monday citing a person familiar with the plans.】

item.title: 美国 3 月商业活动有所增长，但景气进一步恶化
item.description: 3 月份，美国商业活动有所回升，但对进口关税和政府大幅削减开支的担忧与日俱增，继续拖累市场情绪和今年下半年的前景。【原文：U.S. business activity picked up in March, but growing fears over import tariffs and deep government spending cuts continued to weigh on sentiment and prospects for the rest of the year.】

item.title: 美国最高法院驳回赌场大亨永利挑战《纽约时报》诉沙利文诽谤规则的申请
item.description: 美国最高法院周一驳回了赌场大亨史蒂夫-永利（Steve Wynn）要求撤销其在 1964 年对《纽约时报》诉沙利文案（New York Times v. Sullivan）做出的具有里程碑意义的裁决中确立的诽谤保护措施的请求，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统和最高法院的两位保守派法官都对这一标准提出了质疑。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court turned away on Monday a bid by casino mogul Steve Wynn to roll back defamation protections established in its landmark 1964 ruling in the case New York Times v. Sullivan - a standard that has been questioned by President Donald Trump and two of its own conservative justices.】

item.title: 黄金反弹吸引投资者在数月资金外流后重返矿业股
item.description: 由于创纪录的高金价改善了企业的利润前景并增加了现金流，投资于金矿企业的基金将在3月份吸引到一年多来最大的月度净流入。【原文：Funds that invest in gold miners are set to attract their largest net monthly inflows in more than a year in March, as record-high gold prices improve firms' profit outlooks and boost cash flow.】

item.title: 据 Semafor 报道，美国财政部准备精简银行业监管机构
item.description: 据 Semafor 周一报道，美国财政部正在准备关于精简部分银行监管机构的建议，以寻求在监督美国最大的贷款机构方面发挥更大的作用。【原文：The U.S. Treasury department is preparing recommendations for streamlining some banking regulators, Semafor reported on Monday, as it seeks a stronger role in the oversight of the country's biggest lenders.】

item.title: CNBC 报道称，韩国现代汽车将宣布在美国投资 200 亿美元
item.description: 据 CNBC 周一援引知情人士的话报道，韩国现代汽车公司将宣布在美国投资 200 亿美元，其中包括在路易斯安那州投资 50 亿美元建设钢铁厂。【原文：South Korea's Hyundai is set to announce a $20 billion investment in the United States, including a $5 billion steel plant in Louisiana, CNBC reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 航空租赁公司为滞留俄罗斯的喷气机获得 3.29 亿美元的保险赔偿
item.description: 飞机租赁商 Air Lease Corp 周一表示，公司已收到 3.285 亿美元现金，作为其飞机在俄罗斯入侵乌克兰后被阻止离开俄罗斯的部分保险赔偿金。【原文：Aircraft lessor Air Lease Corp said on Monday it has received $328.5 million in cash, as part of certain insurance settlements related to its aircraft which were blocked from leaving Russia after the country's invasion of Ukraine.】

item.title: 罗珀科技公司将以 16.5 亿美元收购 CentralReach 公司
item.description: 软件公司 Roper Technologies 周一表示，将以约 16.5 亿美元的价格从 Insight Partners 手中收购 CentralReach。【原文：Software firm Roper Technologies to acquire CentralReach from Insight Partners for about $1.65 billion, the company said on Monday.】

item.title: 特朗普与欧盟贸易紧张局势加剧，中葡外长将举行会谈
item.description: 葡萄牙外交部长保罗-兰热尔（Paulo Rangel）和中国外交部长王毅将于周二在北京举行会谈。【原文：Portugal's Foreign Minister Paulo Rangel and Chinese counterpart Wang Yi will hold talks in Beijing on Tuesday, as EU member states fret over the prospect of a trade war with both Washington and Beijing.】

item.title: 对冲基金对欧洲的建筑商、金融公司和能源下注，高盛集团称
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）截至 3 月 21 日的一周数据显示，全球对冲基金连续第二周抛售欧洲股票，重点关注该地区的金融、材料、能源和工业公司。【原文：Global hedge funds sold European stocks for the second straight week in a row with a focus on the region's financial, materials, energy and industrial companies, Goldman Sachs data for the week ending March 21 showed.】

item.title: 英特尔前首席执行官盖尔辛格加盟宗教导向型科技公司 Gloo，推动人工智能发展
item.description: 总部位于科罗拉多州博尔德市、为基督教会和其他宗教团体提供技术工具的 Gloo 公司周一表示，帕特-格尔辛格（Pat Gelsinger）将加入该公司，担任技术主管和执行主席，他将帮助该集团开发虚拟助理和聊天机器人等人工智能工具。【原文：Gloo, a Boulder, Colorado-based firm that offers technology tools to Christian churches and other faith groups, said on Monday that Pat Gelsinger is joining the firm as its head of technology and executive chairman, where he will help the group develop AI tools such as virtual assistants and chatbots.】

item.title: 巴西戈尔航空公司签署破产保护退出融资承诺书
item.description: 巴西戈尔航空公司（Gol）周一表示，该公司已与某些投资者达成了退出融资承诺，但未透露这些投资者的姓名，因为该公司希望退出破产保护程序。【原文：Brazilian airline Gol said on Monday it had entered an exit financing commitment with certain investors, without naming them, as it eyed exiting Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings.】

item.title: 独家报道俄罗斯央行认为低油价周期有可能延长
item.description: 俄罗斯央行警告克里姆林宫的政策制定者，美国和欧佩克有能力让石油市场泛滥，导致 20 世纪 80 年代的长期价格崩溃重演--那次崩溃导致了苏联的解体。【原文：Russia's central bank has warned the Kremlin's policy makers the United States and OPEC have the capacity to flood the oil market and cause a repeat of the prolonged price collapse of the 1980s - which contributed to the downfall of the Soviet Union.】

item.title: Rapid7 与 Jana Partners 达成协议，新增三名董事会董事
item.description: 网络安全公司 Rapid7 周一表示，它已与激进投资者 Jana Partners 达成协议，将向董事会增补三名新董事，其中包括该对冲基金的一名合伙人。【原文：Cybersecurity company Rapid7 on Monday said it has reached an agreement with activist investor Jana Partners to add three new directors to its board, including one of the hedge fund's partners.】

item.title: 中国电动车巨头比亚迪第四季度利润增长 73
item.description: 中国电动汽车（EV）制造商比亚迪周一表示，其第四季度净利润增长了 73.1%，达到创纪录的 150 亿元人民币（合 21 亿美元），这得益于对竞争对手的压价和超越。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle (EV) maker BYD lifted fourth-quarter net profit by 73.1% to a record 15 billion yuan ($2.1 billion), it said on Monday, reaping the rewards from undercutting and outselling its rivals.】

item.title: 大众、宝马集团电动汽车 2 月份在欧洲的销量超过特斯拉
item.description: 研究平台JATO Dynamics周一的数据显示，特斯拉电动汽车2月份在欧洲的销量下降，落后于传统品牌大众和宝马集团，以及来自中国的竞争对手。【原文：Tesla EV sales in Europe have fallen in February behind legacy brand Volkswagen and the BMW group , as well as rivals from China, data by research platform JATO Dynamics showed on Monday.】

item.title: 美中关系委员会主席：中美需要在人工智能领域开展合作
item.description: 美中关系全国委员会（NCUSCR）主席说，中国和美国需要在人工智能领域开展合作，两国在此类技术上的重复努力对两国人民都没有好处。【原文：China and the United States need to cooperate in AI, and duplication of efforts in such technology in the two countries was not good for their citizens, president of the National Committee on United States-China Relations (NCUSCR) said.】

item.title: 中国部分钢铁企业响应国家号召开始减产
item.description: 当地报道称，中国西北部新疆地区的几家钢铁企业从周一开始减产，此前中国政府曾表示有意抑制长期受产能过剩困扰的钢铁行业的产能。【原文：Several steel makers in northwestern China's Xinjiang region began production cuts from Monday, local reports said, after Beijing earlier stated its intent to curb capacity in an industry long plagued by overcapacity.】

item.title: 独家：美国证券交易委员会（SEC）临时主席投了唯一一票反对起诉马斯克
item.description: 在共和党人于今年 1 月执掌美国证券交易委员会的前几天，该机构的五位委员就是否起诉埃隆-马斯克进行了闭门投票。【原文：Days before Republicans took the helm of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission in January, the agency's five commissioners held a closed-door vote on whether to sue Elon Musk.】

item.title: 早间竞价：关税豁免希望支撑市场
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 美国关税有望得到控制，期货跳涨
item.description: 华尔街期货周一跳涨，原因是投资者对美国采取更有分寸的关税措施抱有希望，并等待经济数据发出有关美国经济和通胀健康状况的信号。【原文：Wall Street futures jumped on Monday, as investors held out hope for a more measured approach to U.S. tariffs, and awaited economic data for signals on the health of the U.S. economy and inflation.】

item.title: 日本邮船株式会社（NYK Line）高管称，日本和韩国将难以满足美国对非中国造船的需求
item.description: 一位日本航运业高管周一表示，如果美国总统唐纳德-特朗普计划对与中国有联系的船只征收港口费，美国的盟国日本和韩国将难以迅速加强造船业，以满足美国对替代品的需求。【原文：U.S. allies Japan and South Korea would struggle to quickly ramp up shipbuilding to meet U.S. demand for alternatives under President Donald Trump's plan to impose port fees on China-linked ships, a top Japanese shipping executive said on Monday.】

item.title: 交易技术供应商竞相解决LME市场数据问题
item.description: 服务供应商 Trading Technologies 周一发布通知称，其团队正在努力解决伦敦金属交易所（LME）的市场数据问题。【原文：Trading Technologies, a service provider, said in a notice on Monday that its teams were working to resolve market data issues for the London Metal Exchange (LME).】

item.title: 交易技术供应商竞相解决LME市场数据问题
item.description: 服务供应商 Trading Technologies 周一发布通知称，其团队正在努力解决伦敦金属交易所（LME）的市场数据问题。【原文：Trading Technologies, a service provider, said in a notice on Monday that its teams were working to resolve market data issues for the London Metal Exchange (LME).】

item.title: 诺和诺德授权中国生物技术公司开发肥胖症候选药物，售价高达 20 亿美元
item.description: 丹麦制药商诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk）获得了总部位于中国的联合实验室国际公司（United Laboratories International）的减肥药候选药物的全球开发、生产和销售权，交易金额高达 20 亿美元。【原文：Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk has secured the global rights to develop, manufacture and sell China-based United Laboratories International's weight-loss drug candidate in a deal worth up to $2 billion.】

item.title: 彭博社：关税威胁下美国铜进口量飙升至 50 万吨
item.description: 彭博社周一在一份报告中称，Mercuria 估计约有 50 万吨铜运往美国，而正常情况下每月进口量约为 7 万吨，这是由可能征收关税引发的。【原文：Mercuria estimates that about 500,000 tons of copper are heading to the U.S., against normal monthly imports of around 70,000 tons, triggered by the potential imposition of tariffs, Bloomberg said in a report on Monday.】

item.title: 禽流感爆发期间，美国向巴西采购鸡蛋并考虑其他来源
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府试图降低禽流感导致的高昂价格，美国已将一度仅用于宠物食品的巴西鸡蛋进口量增加了近一倍，并正在考虑放宽对肉用鸡所产鸡蛋的规定。【原文：The U.S. has almost doubled imports of Brazilian eggs once used only for pet food and is considering relaxing regulations for eggs laid by chickens raised for meat, as President Donald Trump's administration seeks to bring down sky-high prices spiked by bird flu.】
